title: Looking for ONE person for a happy LTR
text:
A little about me...

My name is Brian and I am 44. I am five foot eight, 165 pounds... brown hair and eyes. I am Jewish, if that matters to you. I'm out, but I don't make a big deal about being gay in public. It's not something I'm ashamed of, just haven't been an issue for me. I have dated a few guys in the past, and have been in one long-term relationship for 2 1/2 years. I know what I want, and hope to find someone special to share the rest of my life with. I'm not looking for a hookup, so if you are just looking for sex, please do not reply. I know there must be at least one person out there that wants to find someone to spend their life with.

I love to cuddle, make out, and hold someone. I am str8 acting, but that does not mean I don't enjoy holding hands in the car with someone special, if the feeling is right. I love falling asleep with my arm around my love, or with his arm around me. I love being close, and that does not necessarily mean sexual, just close. I also enjoy giving back, neck, and shoulder massages, even foot rubs... I like making my guy feel special. 

Distance between us
Let me start by saying I live in Bolingbrook...and if you are going to judge me by how far we live from each other, and not get to know me, please stop reading. I'm not looking for Mr. Right Now, I'm looking to find someone I can spend the rest of my life with. Mr Right may not be your next-door neighbor... but I'm willing to travel a bit if I find him, and I hope he would do the same for me. Trying to find a match typically does not mean a neighbor, that would be a friend with benefits. I want the kind of guy that's glad to talk on the phone, happy to see each other after being apart, and interested in spending non-sexual time together.

What I do for a Living
I have my own business. I am a computer tech, and I sell items on-line. I love custom building computers, virus/spyware removal, and anything really that deals with computers. I love what I do... and it does keep me busy and pays my bills. I can flex my schedule, and spend time with someone special. November through January, I am usually very busy with my on-line sales, but I have no problems making time for someone. Just because I work a lot and love what I do, it does not mean I can't make time for someone special. I will gladly change my hours to accommodate.

For people interested in sex...
I am not looking for sex or to hook up, I am looking for a partner in life. If I find someone special, someone who wants to get to know me for me and start a relationship, here is a little about me. I can be a very sexual and intimate person when it comes to making love, more than once a day is more than possible. With someone I love, I can be versatile, as I feel if you love someone, you make love to him, and you don't just have sex. It's not about sex, it's about the time you spend together, intimately, even cuddling or sleeping. I also don't like routines, as making love should have no routine. It need not matter what a couple does when intimate, if they love each other. Planned routines get boring and stale. I have just as much enjoyment falling asleep with my arm around him or his arm around me, as I do making love. I want a guy with a heart of gold, as I've been told I have. 

Now, to elaborate, I am not looking to meet someone and have a sexual relationship or friendship. I would like to find someone who wants to get to know me for me, and vice versa. I would like to find someone that would not mind cuddling, making out, watching television or movies in each others arms, even going to bed together with our arms around each other. But, this does not mean I am looking to have sex when I meet someone. Sex is a powerful way to show someone how much you love them, but too many gay men have sex and think its love. Sex is a product of your love, not a reason for it.

What do I like doing?
I love movies, music, bowling, tennis, racquetball, computers, video games, cooking, dining out, hanging with friends, staying in with someone special. As far as movies, I like comedies, science fiction, action/adventure. As far as music, I like Tears For Fears, Styx, The Monkees, Savage Garden, Erasure, Def Leppard, new country, 80's music.... I can also get into other kinds of music, I'm not closed minded. I do like plays and musicals, but haven't made as much time to go as I would like. I'm really not much of a bar person... not that I don't go to bars, but it's not my thing. I wouldn't mind going to a bar with someone special and have a few drinks, but I'm not one for "showing off" that I found someone special. 

I am open to new experiences. Age is just a number... it's not your age that's important; it's how you spend your time together. I may have experienced something before, but when you experience it as a couple, it may have a whole new meaning. :)

What am I looking for?
I am looking for a guy typically younger than me... as I seem to get along best with guys younger than me. I like guys who are in decent/average shape, and clean-shaven. Not a requirement, but I would not mind finding someone shorter than me, but I am not going for looks, I am going for a match here, a true relationship. I don't use drugs, and hope he doesn't either... and I hope he is a non-smoker, but I can deal with it if he smokes or is quitting. I would like to find a man who takes care of himself, and cares about what he looks like. I would love to find another computer guy, or a man that doesn't mind that I sell video games and electronics on-line. It would be nice to have a few things in common other than sex! :-P

I would like to find someone who is educated, and who has a decent job... something he enjoys. I don't care how much you make; as long as you enjoy what you do for a living. I know people do work odd hours at times, but the time you spend together is what's important. I am more than willing to make time for someone special. 

One thing that is very important to me is communication. For any successful relationship, both men need to be able to communicate with each other. I know relationships can be difficult, and problems can arise, but I would like a man who is not afraid to communicate. Communication is the key for business, friendships, and relationships. Even if an issue arises, talk about it! A guy who's willing to chat and communicate instead of and a relationship to avoid confrontation would be ideal.

Like I said, I'm not looking for a hookup here... so if you are looking for sex, or a casual BF, or even a friend with benefits, please do not reply. I am hoping to find someone that wants to spend a long time together, and be a monogamous couple. I might not want to have sex with anyone for some time... as I want to get to know and trust someone first (but that can change depending on how the relationship develops). 


Thank you for reading my post.
Brian

title: Its hard finding that needle in the haystack...
text:
A little about me...
My name is Brian and I am 45. I am five foot eight, 170 pounds... brown hair and eyes. I am Jewish, if that matters to you. I'm out, but I don't make a big deal about being gay in public. It's not something I'm ashamed of, just haven't been an issue for me. I have dated a few guys in the past, and have been in one long-term relationship for 2½ years. I know what I want, and hope to find someone special to share the rest of my life with. I'm not looking for a hookup, so if you are just looking for sex, please do not reply. I know there must be at least one person out there that wants to find someone to spend their life with.

I love to cuddle, make out, and hold someone. I am str8 acting, but that does not mean I don't enjoy holding hands in the car with someone special, if the feeling is right. I love falling asleep with my arm around my love, or with his arm around me. I love being close, and that does not necessarily mean sexual, just close. I also enjoy giving back, neck, and shoulder massages, even foot rubs... I like making my guy feel special. 

Distance between us
Let me start by saying I live in Bolingbrook...
and if you are going to judge me by how far we live from each other, and not get to know me, please stop reading. I'm not looking for Mr. Right Now, I'm looking to find someone I can spend the rest of my life with. Mr Right may not be your next-door neighbor... but I'm willing to travel a bit if I find him, and I hope he would do the same for me. Trying to find a match typically does not mean a neighbor, that would be a friend with benefits. I want the kind of guy that's glad to talk on the phone, happy to see each other after being apart, and interested in spending non-sexual time together.


What I do for a Living
I have my own business. I am a computer tech, and I sell items on-line. I love custom building computers, virus/spyware removal, and anything really that deals with computers. I love what I do... and it does keep me busy and pays my bills. I can flex my schedule, and spend time with someone special. November through January, I am usually very busy with my on-line sales, but I have no problems making time for someone. Just because I work a lot and love what I do, it does not mean I can't make time for someone special. I will gladly change my hours to accommodate.


For people interested in sex...
I am not looking for sex or to hook up, I am looking for a partner in life. If I find someone special, someone who wants to get to know me for me and start a relationship, here is a little about me. I can be a very sexual and intimate person when it comes to making love, more than once a day is more than possible. With someone I love, I can be versatile, as I feel if you love someone, you make love to him, and you don't just have sex. It's not about sex, it's about the time you spend together, intimately, even cuddling or sleeping. I also don't like routines, as making love should have no routine. It need not matter what a couple does when intimate, if they love each other. Planned routines get boring and stale. I have just as much enjoyment falling asleep with my arm around him or his arm around me, as I do making love. I want a guy with a heart of gold, as I've been told I have. 

Now, to elaborate, I am not looking to meet someone and have a sexual relationship or friendship. I would like to find someone who wants to get to know me for me, and vice versa. I would like to find someone that would not mind cuddling, making out, watching television or movies in each others arms, even going to bed together with our arms around each other. But, this does not mean I am looking to have sex when I meet someone. Sex is a powerful way to show someone how much you love them, but too many gay men have sex and think it is love. Sex is a product of your love, not a reason for it.

What do I like doing?
I love movies, music, bowling, tennis, racquetball, computers, video games, cooking, dining out, hanging with friends, staying in with someone special. As far as movies, I like comedies, science fiction, action/adventure. As far as music, I like Tears For Fears, Styx, The Monkees, Savage Garden, Erasure, Def Leppard, new country, 80's music.... I can also get into other kinds of music, I'm not closed minded. I do like plays and musicals, but haven't made as much time to go as I would like. I'm really not much of a bar person... not that I don't go to bars, but it's not my thing. I wouldn't mind going to a bar with someone special and have a few drinks, but I'm not one for "showing off" that I found someone special. 

I am open to new experiences. Age is just a number... it's not your age that's important; it's how you spend your time together. I may have experienced something before, but when you experience it as a couple, it may have a whole new meaning. :)

What am I looking for?
I am looking for a guy typically younger than me... as I seem to get along best with guys younger than me. I like guys who are in decent/average shape, and clean-shaven. Not a requirement, but I would not mind finding someone shorter than me, but I am not going for looks, I am going for a match here, a true relationship. I don't use drugs, and hope he doesn't either... and I hope he is a non-smoker, but I can deal with it if he smokes or is quitting. I would like to find a man who takes care of himself, and cares about what he looks like. I would love to find another computer guy, or a man that doesn't mind that I sell video games and electronics on-line. It would be nice to have a few things in common other than sex! :-P

I would like to find someone who is educated, and who has a decent job... something he enjoys. I don't care how much you make; as long as you enjoy what you do for a living. I know people do work odd hours at times, but the time you spend together is what's important. I am more than willing to make time for someone special. 

One thing that is very important to me is communication. For any successful relationship, both men need to be able to communicate with each other. I know relationships can be difficult, and problems can arise, but I would like a man whos not afraid to communicate. Communication is the key for business, friendships, and relationships. Even if an issue arises, talk about it! A guy who's willing to chat and communicate instead of and a relationship to avoid confrontation would be ideal.

Like I said, I'm not looking for a hookup here... so if you are looking for sex, or a casual BF, or even a friend with benefits, please do not reply. I am hoping to find someone that wants to spend a long time together, and be a monogamous couple. I might not want to have sex with anyone for some time... as I want to get to know and trust someone first (but that can change depending on how the relationship develops). 


Thank you for reading my post.

Brian

title: Searching For A Good Man With A Great Heart...
text:
I'm sitting here in front of my computer trying to make sense out of all this. Exactly why I need to post a personal ad on this website is still a mystery to me; alas, I feel compelled to put myself out there in an attempt to find a gentleman who understands the true value of a devoted heart. Seems guys like you and me are a rarity these days. Exactly why this is so doesn't make it any easier to those who are not into any bar scene or void social group or monotonous personals site. No, there are not many options open, and we have to really put ourselves out there in as many ways as we can to reach out to fate in an attempt to find our One True Love. 

Maybe my future guy is squeezing a cantaloupe at Jewel at this very moment...or having a coffee at Starbuck's...or making a decision which will change the world as we know it...or even reading this profile right here and now. All one man needs to establish a great relationship, or ltr, is an open mind and an open heart. 

Please accept this as an open invitation to those desiring a contented heart and a happier, healthier spirit. 

I'm a GWM, forty-eight, drug and disease free, Jefferson Park resident who fully understands that a loving heart knows no bounds. I consider myself deeply romantic, affable, nurturing and affectionate -- one of the good guys. I enjoy life and absorb all the great things that life has to offer; however, I know that everything means so much more when shared with a great man. Compassion is key, and I don't hear this word used enough these days. It is important that, as a couple, we show compassion for not only our partner but for others who touch our lives. In doing so, we become enriched as a couple and create a stronger identity. 

Now, I can go on endlessly about candlelight dinners and moonlight walks, which are wonderful, but what is most romantic to me is a gentle touch, a warm embrace and a sparkle in the eye which shows without words how very much my companion is loved and respected and celebrated for who he is. 

If what you have just read strikes a cord with you, I welcome your responding to me. All it takes is one person to make all the difference in the world. There is no drama. There is no guile. There is only sincerity in the desire to locate my soul-mate. We are not meant to be alone. We are not meant to be sad. We are meant to be loved and appreciated and fulfilled. 

The person who is my partner would have the joyous freedom to be himself and never, ever go a single day without knowing he is loved. 

As you can tell, I have not mentioned one thing about my finding a guy with a particular body type or age or being a top or bottom or sideways. What is essential is invisible to the eye. Twenty, thirty years down the road, we will not look as we do now no matter how many Botox injections we get. 

I want someone I can enjoy a sunset with as he holds me tight in his protective arms. 

So, with this, I am sending my note here into cyber-world with the greatest of good wishes to everyone who encounters it and is touched in some way. My greatest compliment would be a kind response from you. 

Amazing how a sunset can go from something taken for granted to the most beautiful thing in the world.

title: Something just for Us?
text:
Maybe he still is but the spark just isn't there anymore. You're lucky, you had a spark. Me? I love her but I didn't marry for love. No, I didn't marry for money - or sex - either. I had my reasons and if you get past this post maybe you'll find out one day. Everyone has their own reasons and although they may have seemed like a good idea at the time, every action, good or bad, has a consequence. My consequence? Passion, excitement, butterflies and all that good stuff. This isn't about sex though. It's about a relationship, a person who makes you laugh, makes you giddy, and is far removed from all the "how are the kids? did you pay the bills? need to call the roofer" conversations that beat down on the people we once were.

Is this wrong? Probably but then aren't most of things that make us truly happy wrong at some point? At some point we have to quit living for other people.

Is this some desperate plea from a husband bored with his wife? No, I'm not desperate and I'm not bored. I have a full and interesting life. Children, work, friends, events...but I want something of my own. That random text that makes me laugh out loud, the thought of sneaking away with you for the day and doing whatever we want, the memory of our first passionate kiss.

If you don't understand this you don't need to respond. If you're serious you will respond with as much heart as I did when I wrote it.

Looks? I truly couldn't care less so much as the connection, understanding, and mutual respect for the situation. I'm just an average guy, far from perfect and don't demand it from others, only just be around my age so we actually have something to start with...more?

text:

But most of all I miss the simplest of things, like being able to curl up on the couch on a Sunday and have a nice lazy day, or being able to spoon as I go to sleep. It's not all about sex, it's about companionship with another human being. I know there are many people out there that feel the same way, but are too afraid to let themselves have those very simple comforts. Why? Why is it so difficult to allow ourselves something that can be so simple?

I know that something like this cannot be had unless you really know the person, it's a security thing, and I get it. So, of course this will not happen over night, or even anytime soon. But wouldn't it be nice, a month from now, to know that when you just want someone to hold you, to feel that peaceful feeling that only can be had when being closely held, wouldn't it be nice to have someone you can text or call and simply say "can I come stay with you tonight?" or on a lazy Sunday, "can you come over today?"

My name is Brian and I am 45. I am five foot eight, 170 pounds... brown hair and eyes. I am Jewish, if that matters to you. I'm out, but I don't make a big deal about being gay in public. It's not something I'm ashamed of, just haven't been an issue for me. I have dated a few guys in the past, and have been in one long-term relationship for 2Â½ years. I know what I want, and hope to find someone special to share the rest of my life with. I'm not looking for a hookup, so if you are just looking for sex, please do not reply. I know there must be at least one person out there that wants to find someone to spend their life with.

I love to cuddle, make out, and hold someone. I am str8 acting, but that does not mean I don't enjoy holding hands in the car with someone special, if the feeling is right. I love falling asleep with my arm around my love, or with his arm around me. I love being close, and that does not necessarily mean sexual, just close. I also enjoy giving back, neck, and shoulder massages, even foot rubs... I like making my guy feel special. 

Distance between us
Let me start by saying I live in Bolingbrook...
and if you are going to judge me by how far we live from each other, and not get to know me, please stop reading. I'm not looking for Mr. Right Now, I'm looking to find someone I can spend the rest of my life with. Mr Right may not be your next-door neighbor... but I'm willing to travel a bit if I find him, and I hope he would do the same for me. Trying to find a match typically does not mean a neighbor, that would be a friend with benefits. I want the kind of guy that's glad to talk on the phone, happy to see each other after being apart, and interested in spending non-sexual time together.


What I do for a Living
I have my own business. I am a computer tech, and I sell items on-line. I love custom building computers, virus/spyware removal, and anything really that deals with computers. I love what I do... and it does keep me busy and pays my bills. I can flex my schedule, and spend time with someone special. November through January, I am usually very busy with my on-line sales, but I have no problems making time for someone. Just because I work a lot and love what I do, it does not mean I can't make time for someone special. I will gladly change my hours to accommodate.


For people interested in sex...
I am not looking for sex or to hook up, I am looking for a partner in life. If I find someone special, someone who wants to get to know me for me and start a relationship, here is a little about me. I can be a very sexual and intimate person when it comes to making love, more than once a day is more than possible. With someone I love, I can be versatile, as I feel if you love someone, you make love to him, and you don't just have sex. It's not about sex, it's about the time you spend together, intimately, even cuddling or sleeping. I also don't like routines, as making love should have no routine. It need not matter what a couple does when intimate, if they love each other. Planned routines get boring and stale. I have just as much enjoyment falling asleep with my arm around him or his arm around me, as I do making love. I want a guy with a heart of gold, as I've been told I have. 

Now, to elaborate, I am not looking to meet someone and have a sexual relationship or friendship. I would like to find someone who wants to get to know me for me, and vice versa. I would like to find someone that would not mind cuddling, making out, watching television or movies in each others arms, even going to bed together with our arms around each other. But, this does not mean I am looking to have sex when I meet someone. Sex is a powerful way to show someone how much you love them, but too many gay men have sex and think it is love. Sex is a product of your love, not a reason for it.

What do I like doing?
I love movies, music, bowling, tennis, racquetball, computers, video games, cooking, dining out, hanging with friends, staying in with someone special. As far as movies, I like comedies, science fiction, action/adventure. As far as music, I like Tears For Fears, Styx, The Monkees, Savage Garden, Erasure, Def Leppard, new country, 80's music.... I can also get into other kinds of music, I'm not closed minded. I do like plays and musicals, but haven't made as much time to go as I would like. I'm really not much of a bar person... not that I don't go to bars, but it's not my thing. I wouldn't mind going to a bar with someone special and have a few drinks, but I'm not one for "showing off" that I found someone special. 

I am open to new experiences. Age is just a number... it's not your age that's important; it's how you spend your time together. I may have experienced something before, but when you experience it as a couple, it may have a whole new meaning. :)

What am I looking for?
I am looking for a guy typically younger than me... as I seem to get along best with guys younger than me. I like guys who are in decent/average shape, and clean-shaven. Not a requirement, but I would not mind finding someone shorter than me, but I am not going for looks, I am going for a match here, a true relationship. I don't use drugs, and hope he doesn't either... and I hope he is a non-smoker, but I can deal with it if he smokes or is quitting. I would like to find a man who takes care of himself, and cares about what he looks like. I would love to find another computer guy, or a man that doesn't mind that I sell video games and electronics on-line. It would be nice to have a few things in common other than sex! :-P

I would like to find someone who is educated, and who has a decent job... something he enjoys. I don't care how much you make; as long as you enjoy what you do for a living. I know people do work odd hours at times, but the time you spend together is what's important. I am more than willing to make time for someone special. 

One thing that is very important to me is communication. For any successful relationship, both men need to be able to communicate with each other. I know relationships can be difficult, and problems can arise, but I would like a man whos not afraid to communicate. Communication is the key for business, friendships, and relationships. Even if an issue arises, talk about it! A guy who's willing to chat and communicate instead of and a relationship to avoid confrontation would be ideal.

Like I said, I'm not looking for a hookup here... so if you are looking for sex, or a casual BF, or even a friend with benefits, please do not reply. I am hoping to find someone that wants to spend a long time together, and be a monogamous couple. I might not want to have sex with anyone for some time... as I want to get to know and trust someone first (but that can change depending on how the relationship develops). 


Thank you for reading my post.

Brian

title: Writer wanted!

I'd like to find a literate, smart, curious woman who is interested in erotica, who would like to write back and forth and we can develop some written fantasies together. This is Craigslist, so I expect to get bizarre responses. Don't solicit me for sex, and I will not sign up on a website or participate in any credit card scams. We are clean, well groomed, and drug, disease and drama free, absolutely discreet, respectful of privacy and limits, and creative and considerate lovers who will satisfy your needs whether they include a gentle oil massage after a stressful day, imaginative role play or a scenario that has only existed in your imagination...

We can host in our upscale home just north of downtown and offer a safe, no pressure, environment...please do not contact us unless you are a woman willing to share a phone number for voice verification and you are ready make new friends... your age, race, or marital status are not important to us...whether you are a first timer or a lady with experience...you won't be disappointed!!!
